intro: Ludia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth surface, while its stems are woody and often covered in fine hairs. Ludia madagascariensis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
